channel.title: Help [Delta]
channel.description:
Can Someone explain me what this code does ?
[code]client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[playerId];[/code]
Its would be very helpful.

item.title: Help [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“walkineagle, post:2, topic:413931”]It’s initiating the variable ‘c’ as a client, and setting it to all the players on the server through the playerHandler.
so read it like this:
client (which is ‘c’) = all of the players connected to playerHandler.[/quote]
Wrong…

PlayerHandler.players is an array filled with the class “Player” and you are going to the [playerId] index in the array. Think of the term “array” being a huge list all bundled together by identification numbers. A player is the equivalent of a client (because Delta loves to make things complicated and stupid). Also, you are incorrectly accessing a static variable (just an fyi), this would suffice.

client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId];

Read full topic

item.title: Help [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @walkineagle walkineagle
item.description:
@walkineagle wrote:

It’s initiating the variable ‘c’ as a client, and setting it to all the players on the server through the playerHandler.
so read it like this:
client (which is ‘c’) = all of the players connected to playerHandler.

Read full topic
